title: Wanted murderer and armed robber is shot dead in Los Angeles after confronting officers with a gun
text:
A man wanted for murder and armed robbery has been shot dead in a confrontation with police.

Police have not revealed the identity of the 22-year-old suspect, but said that he had been under surveillance on Wednesday morning in Los Angeles.

He was being watched by police when he confronted officers while shirtless, and with a backpack on, around 10.20am. FOX 11 reports that he came out of an apartment with a gun and authorities ordered him to put his hands up.

Someone yelled 'he's got a gun' and officers soon fired. The suspect was pronounced dead at the scene.

A 22-year-old man wanted for murder and armed robbery was shot dead Wednesday morning in a confrontation with police

He was suspected of killing Antonio Rodriguez, 52, on Monday at an apartment when the suspect reportedly attempted to rob him

The man was suspected of killing Antonio Rodriguez, 52, on Monday at an apartment when the suspect reportedly attempted to rob him.

The next day the suspect robbed a liquor store on Kester Ave and Burbank Blvd, just a few blocks from where he lived.

The store clerk told FOX 11 that the suspect pointed a gun and threatened to shoot him.

He then fled the scene, only taking bottles of liquor and wine.

Surveillance photo showed the suspect wearing a red shirt and black jacket, helping police to identify the man.
